alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 12:57PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish through 130 PM CDT... At 1256 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lacombe, or 9 miles west of Slidell, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Pearl River, Lacombe and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 259 and 273. Interstate 12 between mile markers 70 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding on some poor drainage roadways. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Additionally, heavy rainfall will reduce visibility along area roadways, including portions of Interstates 10, 12, and 59. Motorists should use extra caution and be prepared for sudden changes in visibility.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany
